text: A major disadvantage of a socialist economy is that

options.D: there is high level of unemployment

explanation: One of the major criticisms of socialism are that socialist countries have a tendency to develop too many layers of bureaucracy, which leads to corrupt practices. The government controls much of the economy's resource. They decides the whats, whens, and hows of production.

text:
The privatization of public enterprises will lead to efficient management of resources in the economy.
This statement can best be described as
explanation: Inductive reasoning is a type of logical thinking that involves forming generalizations based on specific incidents you've experienced, observations you've made, or facts you know to be true or false.

text: The sign of the slope of a graph in economic analysis is important because it

options.A: shows whether a good is normal or inferior
options.C: reveals the magnitude of the change between variables
options.D: helps to determine the unit of measurement of variables

explanation: The concept of slope is important in economics because it is used to measure the rate at which changes are taking place. It shows how things change and about how one item changes in response to a change in another item.

text: If the quantity of rice bought decreases from 250 tonnes to 200 tonnes owing to a 2% rise in price, it shows that there is a change in
explanation: A change in quantity demanded refers to a change in the specific quantity of a product that buyers are willing and able to buy usually caused by a change in the price. From the question above, a rise in prise led to a corresponding change in the quantity demanded from 250 to 200 units.

text: A rise in income will, ceteris paribus, bring about

options.A: a movement along the demand curve
options.B: a leftward shift of the demand curve
options.C: a rightward shift of the demand curve
options.D: no effect on the demand curve

explanation: All things being equal, a rise in income will lead to a rightward shift in demand. A rightward shift in the demand curve could also be as a result of higher price of a substitute good, lower price of a complement good, etc.

text: If the price of an item increases by 8% while the quantity demanded falls from 1500 units to 1492 units, the demand is said to be
explanation: Elastic demand is a situation where a change in prices leads to a change in the quantity demanded.

text: Comparison of interpersonal utility is impossible because
explanation: The comparison of interpersonal utility is impossible because the utility or the satisfaction derived from consuming a product is subject to what that individual has stated. It is impossible to say that Mr. A and Mr. derived the same level of satisfaction after consuming a bottle of water. This is because their level of satisfaction differs individually and only implicit values are used in comparison

text: When the slope of the total utility curve is declining, the marginal utility of a consumer will be increasing if he

options.A: stops consuming more of the commodity

explanation:
Marginal utility refers to the additional satisfaction a consumer derives from the consumption of an additional unit of a product. As more and more of a product is consumed by that consumer, the utility/satisfaction he gets reduces.
Therefore, the marginal utility of a product is greater when a person has fewer of them, but as the accumulation of goods increases, the marginal utility of additional goods declines.

text: The supply of cocoa is influenced by
explanation: The supply of cocoa is influenced by the demand for beverages. Cocoa is used for the production of beverages such as tea and coffee.

text: If quantity supplied is constant irrespective of price changes, the supply elasticity is
explanation: perfectly inelastic is a situation in which the price of a product will have no effect on the supply. This means that, a change in price would lead to no change in the quantity supplied

text: The cost elasticity of supply is a useful instrument for measuring
explanation: The price/cost elasticity of supply measures the degree to which a change in price would affect the quantity of goods the producer is willing to produce and supply.

text: The invisible hand promotes the interests of
explanation: The invisible hand is a natural force that self regulates the market economy. An example of invisible hand is an individual making a decision to buy noodles and egg, that person decision will make the economic society as a whole better off. This individual(s) are consumers that indirectly influences market economy as regards, what to produce, when to produce, how to produce and for whom to produce

text: Fixing price above equilibrium will cause

options.A: demand and supply to remain constant

explanation: Fixing prices above equilibrium will cause an increase in supply because suppliers will be willing to produce more since they will sell at a high price

text: An important function of the price system is to

options.A: ensure that producers' profits remain high
options.C: allocate resources to most productive uses
options.D: protect the economic interests of government

explanation: The distribution of scarce resources among competing producers is one of the main functions of price mechanism. Those indus­tries which can offer the highest prices for the factors of production are able to attract supplies.

text: If all factors are variable in the long run,firms will experience
explanation: In the longrun, all production factors are variable (changes) and a firm operating in the longrun would enjoy increasing returns to scale because they will be operating at a higher level of output with lower cost.

text: The equilibrium point of a firm is attained at the point where the isoquant is
explanation: The firm is in equilibrium at the point where the isoquant curve is tangent to the iso-cost line. At this point, the firm is maximising its output level by employing the optimal combination of capital and labour.

text: The long-run average cost curve touches to the short-run average cost curves at the

options.A: minimum points of all short run average cost curves
options.B: declining points of all short-run average cost curves
options.C: minimum point of only one of the short-run cost curves
options.D: rising points of all short-run average cost curves

explanation: click here

text: If a firm doubles all inputs in the long run and the total output is less than doubled, this results in
explanation: A decreasing returns to scale occurs when the proportion of output is less than the desired increased input during the production process. For example, if input is increased by 3 times, but output is reduced 2 times, the firm or economy has experienced decreasing returns to scale.

text: Patents and copyrights enable monopolists to

options.A: determine the quality of their products
options.B: determine the scale of their products
options.C: restrict information flow to new firms

explanation:
Patents are used to prevent others from making or selling an invention, example computers, phones etc.  while Copyright is the exclusive right that the owner of an intellectual property has. It protects the creator's work from unauthorized duplication or use. Example music and movies production.
In a monopolistic setting, it is used to determine the size or extent of a producing a particular product. This is to prevent other market players from making or producing the product without permission.

text: A discriminatory monopoly is characterized by

options.A: a common elasticity in different markets
options.C: a finite elasticity in all markets

explanation: click here

text: Net National Product is derived by deducting
explanation:
Net national product is gotten by adding;
The market value of all finished goods + the market value of all finished services - the depreciation of those goods and services =net national product.

text:
The investment expenditure of an economy changes by N2 million and MPC is 0.75
The multiplier is

The investment expenditure of an economy changes by N2 million and MPC is 0.75
What is the change in income?
explanation:
MPC is a proportion of an aggregate raise in pay that a consumer spends on the consumption of goods and services, as opposed to saving it.
Investment expenditure = 2,000,000MPC = 0.750.75 x 2,000,000 = 1,500,000
change in income = 2,000,000 - 1,500,000 = 500,000

text: If a basket of commodities cost N120 in the base year and N240 in the current year, calculate the price index
explanation:
Price index is gotten by diving the current market price by the base year price. Hence we have;
Price index = \(\frac{240}{120}\) x 100 = 200

text: The minimum amount which banks are required to deposit with the central bank is determined by the
explanation: Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) is a certain minimum amount of deposit that the commercial banks have to hold as reserves with the central bank.

text: The major function of money market is to

options.C: stabilize the value of the local currency

explanation: money market is a financial market for sourcing of short term loans. The funds traded on in the money market have a maturity date of 0-3 months

text: An ad valorem tax is imposed on
explanation: An ad valorem tax (Latin for "according to value") is a tax whose amount is based on the value of a transaction or of property. It is typically imposed at the time of a transaction, as in the case of a sales tax or value-added tax (VAT)

text: The primary reason for desiring economic growth is to
explanation: While options B (reduce poverty) and C (redistribute income) are important goals, the overarching aim of economic growth is to increase the overall standard of living for the population by providing more resources, jobs, and opportunities and this is the most direct goal of economic growth.

text: An emerging agricultural export crop in Nigeria is
explanation: Cocoa is the leading agricultural export of the country and Nigeria is currently the world's fourth largest producer of Cocoa, after Ivory Coast, Indonesia and Ghana, and the third largest exporter, after Ivory Coast and Ghana.

text: A strategy for improving agriculture in Nigeria will involve

options.A: controlling the prices of agricultural products

explanation:
One of the ways to improve agriculture in Nigeria is too first ensure self-sufficiency. Agricultural production Nigeria should be able to cater for the needs of the people before working towards exportation.
Nigeria should be able to maintain oneself or itself without outside aid.

text: A sugar industry is best located near the source of
explanation: A sugar industry is best located near the source of raw material. Raw materials can be explained as substance or material used in the manufacturing or primary production of goods.

text: The Malthusian theory was concerned about the relationship between

options.A: population growth rates of the rich and the poor nations
options.C: population growth rate and natural resources

explanation: The Malthusian Theory of Population is the theory of exponential population growth and arithmetic food supply growth.

text: In a village of 50 persons, 10 immigrated, 25 died and 5 emigrated in year. Determine the total population
explanation:
Emigrants are people who move in to settle in a particular region (increasing the new population)Immigrants are people who move out of a particular region to another place. (Reducing the old place of residence)
50 + 10 = 60 new population
Less number of dead people and immigrants;  = 30
60 - 30 = 30

text: A deficit balance of payments is measured by subtracting the debits from the credits in the
explanation: A balance of payments deficit means the country imports more goods, services, and capital than it exports. The current account + capital account make up the balance of payment account and when the imports exceeds the exports, it becomes a deficit balance of payment.

text: One of the functions of ECOWAS is to

options.D: provide employment for citizens of member nations

explanation:
Some of the functions of ECOWAS centers on;
- Peace and Security- Developing Infrastructure- Policy harmonization (to facilitate trade)- Good Corporate Governance.

text: The reward on machinery and equipment in the process of production is known as
explanation: Capital' - investment in man-made aids to production including buildings, factories, computers. The reward for capital is interest.

text: The percentage contribution of Agricultural sector is
If the GDP is N60 billion, what is the difference between the contributions of oil and manufacturing sectors?
explanation:
The summation of a piechart is 360°.  To get the figure for manufacturing sector we simply add the figures for oil, agriculture and mining sector and minus it from 360. Thus we have;
160 + 90 + 30 = 280360 - 280 = 80Manufacturing sector = 80°
The difference between Oil sector and manufacturing sector =
Oil sector = \(\frac{160}{360}\) x 100 = 44.44%0.444 x 60,000,000,000 = 26,640,000,000
Manufacturing sector = \(\frac{80}{360}\) x 100 = 22.22%0.222 x 60,000,000,00 = 13,320,000,000
Difference 26,640,000,000 - 13,320,000,000 = 13,320,000,000

text: From the above, calculate the price elasticity of demand
explanation:
price elasticity of demand is calculated as the;
percentage change in quantity demandedpercentage change in price
Change in quantity = 500 - 400 = 100% change  = ​​​​​​100/100 = 1%
Change in price = 70 - 50 = 20% change = 20/100 = 0.2%
price elasticity = \(\frac{1}{0.2}\) = 5

text: The consumer is at equilibrium at point
explanation: The consumer is at equilibrium at point K where the consumption of Y = X (intersection between Y ans X).

text: To move from point M to K, the consumer has to increase the

options.A: consumption of X and reduce the consumption of Y
options.D: consumption of Y and reduce the consumption of X

explanation: At point M, the consumer consumes more of X, to move to point K, the consumer needs to consumer more of Y and less of X. Point K is the point of equilibrium where the combination of K=M

text: From this diagram, the minimum wage OW will lead to

options.D: full employment of factors of production

explanation: The point OW shows that labour is highly utilized and the wage rate is competitive. This means the factors of production (laboour and wage ) have been highly utilized
